CAN’T STAND.Definition: don't like at all, cannot tolerate

HANG.Definition: attach or tie on a wall

HANGING.Definition: being attached to or tied on a wall

SARACEN’S.Definition: of an Arab or Muslim man of the time of the Crusades

ARK.Definition: the large wooden ship built by Noah to save life on earth as told in the Bible

FLEECE.Definition: the thick covering of wool on a sheep

BRICKLAYERS.Definition: people who built walls using bricks

COACH.Definition: a vehicle with four wheels, usually drawn by a horse

GROOM.Definition: a person whose job is to clean and brush horses

DISCIPLINED.Definition: behaving in a very controlled way

OVERPOWERED.Definition: defeated because his army was weaker

PURSUED.Definition: followed in order to be caught

PUT A PRICE ON CHARLES’ HEAD.Definition: offered money as a reward for his capture

IN EXILE.Definition: in the condition of having been sent away from his country for political reasons

ACCOUNTS.Definition: reports or descriptions of the event

HEIR.Definition: the person who would legally receive the property and title of his father after his death

MAID.Definition: a woman who worked as a servant in his home

ILLEGITIMATE.Definition: born of parents who weren't married to each other

NESTING.Definition: using it as a place for laying eggs and protecting its young

NEST.Definition: a place made or chosen by a bird for laying eggs and protecting its young

DEATHBED.Definition: the bed on which he was dying

LEGITIMATE.Definition: born of parents lawfully married to each other

WARDROBE.Definition: a large cupboard in which clothes are stored or kept

CHOLERA.Definition: a dangerous infection caused by drinking dirty water

OUTBREAKS.Definition: sudden occurrences or events of the infection

DOTS.Definition: very small round marks or signs

WATER PUMP.Definition: a device for raising or moving water

HANDLE.Definition: the part by which it was controlled

WELL.Definition: a deep hole in the ground to get water from

FITTINGLY.Definition: in a way that is suitable and right

PUMP.Definition: a device for raising or moving water

HUNG, DRAWN & QUARTERED.Definition: held by the neck from above with a rope, had the inner organs removed and had the body cut into four parts

HUNG.Definition: held by the neck from above with a rope

TREASON.Definition: the crime of showing no loyalty to your country

QUARTERED.Definition: had the body cut into four parts

REFURBISHMENT.Definition: the process of making it new again, clean and re-decorated

SMUGGLERS.Definition: people who illegally moved goods into the country

COASTLINE.Definition: the line of land across the shore

SMUGGLING.Definition: the act of illegally moving goods into the country

BOBBING AROUND.Definition: moving up and down without a specific direction

GLIDE.Definition: move easily without trying hard or making noise

PRISTINE.Definition: clean and in very good condition

MARK.Definition: a small area that was damaged and different from the rest

BEAKS.Definition: the hard pointed parts of a bird's mouth

SCRATCH THE SURFACE.Definition: cover or deal with just a small part of the subject
